creator: bio@msx.ru
text:
in apache 2.0.43 mod_include doesn't take "correct" variables (DOCUMENT_URI and related) during parsing in some cases.

example. 

Options indexes
Headername smth.shtml


smth.shtml contains <!--#echo var="DOCUMENT_URI"-->

in dir. listing:
apache 1.3.27 will insert current path (/dir1/dir2/)
apache 2.0.43 will insert path to smth.shtml (/ssi/smth.shtml)

is it a feature?

I believe that this may have something to do with the header processing being
handled as a sub-request. Mod_include would see the "<!--#echo
var="DOCUMENT_URI"-->" as being processed from inside the file smth.shtml. All
references to environment would be from that reference point (including
DOCUMENT_URI). Try adding "<!--#printenv -->" into smth.shtml to see what I
mean. What you might be looking for is REQUEST_URI instead of DOCUMENT_URI.
creator: rederpj@remulak.net

text: Despite the above suggestion, REQUEST_URI and DOCUMENT_URI are equally broken.
creator: aximili11@hotmail.com

text: Hmm, to differ from 1.3 may have originally been a bug.  But now it has to be a 2.x feature: changing it now would do more harm than good.  I'll treat this as a minor documentation bug, and add a note to the description of DOCUMENT_URI.  Note that REQUEST_URI does show the original request, at least in recent versions.
